Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which tax breaks would go to the wealthiest 1 percent.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that half of the tax breaks would go to the wealthiest 1 percent.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that tax breaks favoring large corporations and millionaires are inherently negative.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that could influence the distribution of tax breaks, which are not considered in the claim.
